articles.headline: With New Taliban Manifesto, Afghan Women Fear the Worst
articles.snippet: Three years into its rule, the movement has codified its harsh Islamic decrees into law that now includes a ban on women’s voices in public.
articles.abstract: Three years into its rule, the movement has codified its harsh Islamic decrees into law that now includes a ban on women’s voices in public.
articles.lead_paragraph: No education beyond the sixth grade. No employment in most workplaces and no access to public spaces like parks, gyms and salons. No long-distance travel if unaccompanied by a male relative. No leaving home if not covered from head to toe.
articles.byline: By Christina Goldbaum and Najim Rahim

articles.headline: Biden Expected to Block U.S. Steel Takeover
articles.snippet: The Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States is expected to raise national security concerns about selling the iconic steel producer to Japan’s Nippon Steel.
articles.abstract: The Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States is expected to raise national security concerns about selling the iconic steel producer to Japan’s Nippon Steel.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden is preparing to soon block an attempt by Japan’s Nippon Steel to buy U.S. Steel on national security grounds, according to three people familiar with the matter, likely sinking a merger that became entangled in election-year politics in the United States.
articles.byline: By Andrew Duehren, Alan Rappeport and Lauren Hirsch

articles.headline: The 96-Year-Old Who Defied a Ban on Female Genital Cutting
articles.snippet: Yassin Fatty, a traditional practitioner of female genital cutting in the West African nation of Gambia, became the first to be convicted there. But her case led to a backlash and a popular campaign to make it legal again.
articles.abstract: Yassin Fatty, a traditional practitioner of female genital cutting in the West African nation of Gambia, became the first to be convicted there. But her case led to a backlash and a popular campaign to make it legal again.
articles.lead_paragraph: There were young girls, sitting nervous and excited in new clothes under the afternoon sun. There were musicians, dancing and plates of food. There were old handmade knives and bright new razor blades.
articles.byline: By Ruth Maclean, Matty Jobe and Kiana Hayeri

articles.headline: Republicans Seize on False Theories About Immigrant Voting
articles.snippet: Activists, party lawyers and state officials are mobilizing behind a crackdown on a supposed scourge of noncitizens’ casting ballots. Voting rights advocates say the effort is spreading misinformation.
articles.abstract: Activists, party lawyers and state officials are mobilizing behind a crackdown on a supposed scourge of noncitizens’ casting ballots. Voting rights advocates say the effort is spreading misinformation.
articles.lead_paragraph: In late July, a group of Republican activists met on a Zoom call to discuss preparations for the November election. The topic was how to keep undocumented immigrants from voting in November, a problem they claim, inaccurately, to be a looming threat to a fair election.

articles.headline: Leaked Reports and Political Heat Are Testing Trust in Economic Data
articles.snippet: The Bureau of Labor Statistics, which tracks prices and employment, faces scrutiny after several missteps. Some questions have gone unanswered.
articles.abstract: The Bureau of Labor Statistics, which tracks prices and employment, faces scrutiny after several missteps. Some questions have gone unanswered.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has been a rough year for the Bureau of Labor Statistics.
articles.byline: By Ben Casselman and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: The Hot Labor Market Has Melted Away. Just Ask New College Grads.
articles.snippet: Unemployment is still low, but job seekers are competing for fewer openings, and hiring is sluggish. That’s a big turnaround from recent years.
articles.abstract: Unemployment is still low, but job seekers are competing for fewer openings, and hiring is sluggish. That’s a big turnaround from recent years.
articles.lead_paragraph: For much of the last three years, employers were fighting one another for workers. Now the tables have turned a bit. Few employers are firing. Layoff rates remain near record lows. But fewer employers are hiring.

articles.headline: How Swing State Politics Are Sinking a Global Steel Deal
articles.snippet: As the Biden administration nears a decision to block the proposed acquisition of U.S. Steel, the debate over national and economic security is being dwarfed by presidential politics.
articles.abstract: As the Biden administration nears a decision to block the proposed acquisition of U.S. Steel, the debate over national and economic security is being dwarfed by presidential politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Biden administration has spent the past three years promoting a policy of “friend-shoring,” which aims to contain China and Russia by forging closer ties with U.S. allies like Europe and Japan.
